sections.heading: deed; default; reinstatement; recorded notice of default; cancellation; costs and expenses
sections.text: (1) Whenever all or a portion of the principal sum of any obligation secured by a trust deed has, prior to the maturity date fixed in such obligation, become due or been declared due by reason of a breach or d

sections.heading: imposes the requirement for notices of default, while this section provides the means by which a trustor may cure the default of an obligation secured by a trust deed
sections.text: First Nat. Bank North Platte v. Cardenas, 299 Neb. 497, 909 N.W.2d 79 (2018).
